nealrichardson commented on issue #6242: ARROW-7634: [Python] Run pyarrow.dataset tests on Appveyor + fix failures to parse Windows file paths
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6242#issuecomment-578228026
 
 
   Failure is https://dev.azure.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=5431&view=logs&j=4c86bc1b-1091-5192-4404-c74dfaad23e7&t=ec99a26b-0264-5e86-36fb-9cfd0ca0f9f3&l=3597 (or https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/30316993/job/y4secmccsm6v5wud#L2186, same error)
   
   Which is not exactly a file path thing, it's asserting the schemas are equal. That's odd.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on issue #6242: ARROW-7634: [Python] Run pyarrow.dataset tests on Appveyor + fix failures to parse Windows file paths
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6242#issuecomment-578228026
 
 
   Failure is https://dev.azure.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=5431&view=logs&j=4c86bc1b-1091-5192-4404-c74dfaad23e7&t=ec99a26b-0264-5e86-36fb-9cfd0ca0f9f3&l=3597 (or https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/30316993/job/y4secmccsm6v5wud#L2186, same error)
   
   ```
   ================================== FAILURES ===================================
   ___________________ test_open_dataset_partitioned_directory ___________________
   tempdir = WindowsPath('C:/Users/appveyor/AppData/Local/Temp/1/pytest-of-appveyor/pytest-0/test_open_dataset_partitioned_0')
       @pytest.mark.parquet
       def test_open_dataset_partitioned_directory(tempdir):
           import pyarrow.parquet as pq
           table = pa.table({'a': range(9), 'b': [0.] * 4 + [1.] * 5})
           for part in range(3):
               path = tempdir / "part={0}".format(part)
               path.mkdir()
               pq.write_table(table, path / "test.parquet")
       
           # no partitioning specified, just read all individual files
           full_table = pa.concat_tables([table] * 3)
           _check_dataset_from_path(tempdir, full_table)
       
           # specify partition scheme with discovery
           dataset = ds.dataset(
               str(tempdir), partitioning=ds.partitioning(flavor="hive"))
           expected_schema = table.schema.append(pa.field("part", pa.int32()))
   >       assert dataset.schema.equals(expected_schema, check_metadata=False)
   E       AssertionError: assert False
   E        +  where False = <built-in method equals of pyarrow.lib.Schema object at 0x000001A4082ED300>(a: int64\nb: double\npart: int32, check_metadata=False)
   E        +    where <built-in method equals of pyarrow.lib.Schema object at 0x000001A4082ED300> = a: int64\nb: double\nmetadata\n--------\n{b'ARROW:schema': b'/////7AAAAAQAAAAAAAKAAwABgAFAAgACgAAAAABAwAMAAAACAAIAAAA'\n   ...             b'EAAQAAAAAAABAiQAAAAUAAAABAAAAAAAAAAIAAwACAAHAAgAAAAAAAAB'\n                  b'QAAAAAEAAABhAAAAAAAAAA=='}.equals
   E        +      where a: int64\nb: double\nmetadata\n--------\n{b'ARROW:schema': b'/////7AAAAAQAAAAAAAKAAwABgAFAAgACgAAAAABAwAMAAAACAAIAAAA'\n   ...             b'EAAQAAAAAAABAiQAAAAUAAAABAAAAAAAAAAIAAwACAAHAAgAAAAAAAAB'\n                  b'QAAAAAEAAABhAAAAAAAAAA=='} = <pyarrow._dataset.Dataset object at 0x000001A4082EDB10>.schema
   pyarrow\tests\test_dataset.py:512: AssertionError
   ```
   
   Which is not exactly a file path thing, it's asserting the schemas are equal. That's odd.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nealrichardson commented on issue #6242: ARROW-7634: [Python] Run pyarrow.dataset tests on Appveyor + fix failures to parse Windows file paths

   Oh I see it now: the hive partitioning ("part" in the path segments) isn't being detected.

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6242: ARROW-7634: [Python] Run pyarrow.dataset tests on Appveyor + fix failures to parse Windows file paths
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6242#issuecomment-578262585
 
 
   It's still the same failure as before I rebased (before the patch of @pitrou to FileSystemFromUri), which is somewhat expected. From the discussion I think we thought the issue is coming from passing a base path path with backslashes to GetTargetStats, which is then leading to backslashes being used in the crawled file paths.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description:
See eg https://dev.azure.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=5217&view=logs&j=4c86bc1b-1091-5192-4404-c74dfaad23e7&t=ec99a26b-0264-5e86-36fb-9cfd0ca0f9f3&l=4066

Failing on the backward slashes of the pathlib file paths, and clearly not run in CI since this was not catched.
fields.summary: [Python] Dataset tests failing on Windows to parse file path
